snippet: In his final address as president of American Roman Catholic bishops, Cardinal Timothy M. Dolan urged them to help Christians who are persecuted overseas.
abstract: Cardinal Timothy M Dolan, in his final address as president of the nation’s Roman Catholic bishops, calls on them to take up the cause of Christians in places like Iraq, Syria, Nigeria and India who are persecuted and killed for their faith; statement represents notable shift in priorities for church that had been focused on what bishops saw as threats to religious liberty in United States.
lead_paragraph: In his final address as president of American Roman Catholic bishops, Cardinal Timothy M. Dolan urged them to help Christians who are persecuted overseas.
